meanings.definition: Not occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The asynchronous rainfall made it difficult to predict when the storm would end.
meanings.sent2: The students submitted their assignments asynchronously, each completing the task at different times.
meanings.sent3: The asynchronous arrival of the guests at the party led to a surprising mix of conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like asynchronous waves, coming and going unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The asynchronous chirping of the crickets created a peaceful nighttime symphony.

meanings.sent1: The asynchronous traffic lights caused confusion among drivers.
meanings.sent2: The team members worked asynchronously on different aspects of the project.
meanings.sent3: The asynchronous dance moves of the performers added an unexpected twist to the routine.
meanings.sent4: His actions and words seemed asynchronous, giving a sense of inconsistency.
meanings.sent5: The asynchronous barking of the dogs echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Describing a type of communication or data transfer where the parties involved do not need to be present or active at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The asynchronous messaging app allowed users to send and receive messages at their convenience.
meanings.sent2: In an asynchronous online class, students can participate in discussions at different times.
meanings.sent3: The asynchronous video call glitched, making it seem like a time-travel conversation.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like an asynchronous connection, always there even when apart.
meanings.sent5: The asynchronous delivery of the package surprised the recipient with its unexpected timing.
